comments:
After upgrading from eclipse 3.1.2 (debian 3.1.2-2) to 3.2, my external ant
builders were not recognised any more.

And whenever I try to add a new one (either via Properties -> Builders -> New or via Import) there is brief disk activity and no dialog appears.

This only happens with one of my projects, i.e. when I create a new project I can add new external builders to it without problems. I'd be happy about an idea how I could track this down further or a workaround. Especially I'd like to be able to remove the offending setting from my project settings, if I could only find it.

Since the backtrace starts with org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfigurationWorkingCopy.writeN
ewFile I filed this against the "Debug" component, because I had no idea where else to file it.

The logfile contains the following backtrace:

FDF

Meanwhile I've discovered that this faulty behaviour occurs, when the root of my project tree is a symbolic link. I've relocated my project to the source of the link, and everything is ok again (more or less, since I had to reconfigure some of my preferences).

If you have any other questions about how to reproduce that bug, feel free to ask. I'm an eclipse newbie and I there's no way I could possibly know which information is relevant for you.

HTH

hmm, I am having trouble reproducing this one. I created a project with its root as a symbolic link as you described, and have not experienced the error.

Can you still reproduce this error?

If so, can you outline the exact steps to produce it?

If you open the launch dialog can you view and edit the builder from 3.1?

If you try this on 3.3M2 or later does the problem still occur?
We made changes to writeNewFile to address a synchronization issue much like the one you are describing (bug 153428).

this is the same synchronization issue as 153428...marking as dupe

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 153428 ***
